bio:
Eun Joo Kim is a Language Lecturer at NYU Shanghai. Prior to joining NYU Shanghai, she was a Predoctoral Teaching Fellow at the University of Minnesota. She holds a PhD from the University of Minnesota, an MA from New York University, and a BA from Brandeis University.

Kim’s current book project theorizes multilingualism and unintelligibility in Korean diasporic literature and performance. She is also working on a translation of contemporary South Korean poetry collection. Her publications include a translated poem in Asymptote.

Research Interests

  • Translation
  • Multilingual literatures
  • Asian American studies
  • Diaspora studies

Courses Taught

  • Global Perspectives on Society - Writing Workshop
  • Perspectives on the Humanities: Embodied Language
  • Writing as Inquiry
